intro: Viguiera microphylla, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, arranged in dense, spherical clusters. Viguiera microphylla is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
